intro: Baissea breviloba, commonly known as the narrow-leaved baissea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of delicate white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its ability to thrive in harsh conditions. Baissea breviloba is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in its native habitat.
